00001 /**
00002   * @file
00003   *
00004   * Speed Test Chip Performance FAQ.
00005   */
00006 
00007 /**
00008  
00009 @page Speed_Test_Chip_Performance Speed Test Chip Performance 
00010 
00011 @section contents Contents
00012 
00013     - @ref What_is_chip_perf 
00014     - @ref Cavium_Speed_Identifier
00015     - @ref Cavium_Speed_Identifier_used
00016     - @ref Chip_Perf_result
00017     - @ref Default_Value 
00018     - @ref Change_Default_value
00019     - @ref Changes_for_multicard
00020     - @ref How_to_get_perf
00021     - @ref Cavium_blocking
00022 
00023 
00024 @section What_is_chip_perf 1. What is Nitrox Chip Performance?
00025 
00026 It is used for measuring Nitrox chip performance in blocking mode.
00027 For measuring the chip performance of Nitrox, request type should
00028 be set to  CAVIUM_SPEED in the user level APIs. This tells the
00029 Nitrox driver to perform blocking speedtest and can be measured
00030 maximum performance of the Nitrox hardware.
00031 <br>
00032 
00033 @section Cavium_Speed_Identifier 2. What is CAVIUM_SPEED identifier and why it is used?
00034 
00035 CAVIUM_SPEED identifier is a request type for blocking chip-performance.
00036 It is used in APIs only in case of Chip-performace for measuring the
00037 performance of Nitrox Chip.
00038 <br>
00039 
00040 
00041 @section Cavium_Speed_Identifier_used 3. When is CAVIUM_SPEED identifier used?
00042 
00043 CAVIUM_SPEED identifier is used only in measuring the Chip performance of the Nitrox processor.
00044 <br>
00045 
00046 
00047 @section Chip_Perf_result  4. What is the result of Chip-performance test?
00048 Chip-performace test retrun the result in output buffer of API, in form of
00049 Speed_Test_Info structure defined in cavium/software/include/cavium_common.h
00050 Result contains number of completed requests, input data length, output
00051 data length and time taken to complete those requests.
00052 <br>
00053 
00054 
00055 @section Default_Value 5. What is the default value of Test-time and what is done by test in that case?
00056 
00057 Default value of Test-time is 0 second. In this case, tests the performance 
00058 of Nitrox Chip for fully loaded command queue.
00059 <br>
00060 
00061 
00062 @section Change_Default_value 6. How to change the default values of Test-time (ie. speed_timeout)?
00063 
00064 Test-time value can be set by the speed_timeout proc entry in /proc/cavium/speed_timeout.
00065 
00066 For example:
00067 If you want to run the test for 10 seconds then set the speed_timeout proc entry as
00068 
00069 bash# echo 10 >/proc/cavium/speed_timeout
00070 <br>
00071 
00072 
00073 @section Changes_for_multicard 7. Is there any changes, if more than one devices are present?
00074 
00075 Yes. If more than one devices are present and CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API flag is
00076 on, then by default Speedtest measure the performance of Nitrox Chip according to
00077 number of Nitrox devices present on the PCI bus.
00078 
00079 For example:
00080 If 2 devices are present and CAVIUM_MULTICARD_API flag is on,
00081 then Speedtest measure the performance of Nitrox Chips for 2 fully loaded command
00082 queue.
00083 <br>
00084 
00085 
00086 @section How_to_get_perf 8. How to get the performace number for a particular SSL/IPSec API?
00087 
00088 To get the performace number for a API, called that API using CAVIUM_SPEED
00089 request type. Then performance test return the result in output buffer.
00090 <br>
00091 
00092 
00093 @section Cavium_blocking 9. Can I use CAVIUM_SPEED identifier in place of CAVIUM_BLOCKING?
00094 
00095 No. If you want to call an API in blocking mode use CAVIUM_BLOCKING in the real time 
00096 ssl application.  CAVIUM_SPEED identifier is used only for measuring the maximum throughput 
00097 by the Nitrox Processor.
00098 
00099 
00100 */
00101
